meanings.definition: The quality or state of being laborious or tedious.
meanings.sent1: Her operoseness in completing the project made it take much longer than expected.
meanings.sent2: The operoseness of the task made everyone avoid volunteering for it.
meanings.sent3: His operoseness in organizing his desk was comical to watch.
meanings.sent4: The operoseness of the maze of hallways in the old building confused visitors.
meanings.sent5: The operoseness of the legal document made it nearly impossible to understand.

meanings.definition: The characteristic of being overly complicated or difficult to accomplish.
meanings.sent1: The operoseness of the new software program frustrated users.
meanings.sent2: The operoseness of the plan made it hard for anyone to follow.
meanings.sent3: The operoseness of the recipe made it seem like a secret code to decipher.
meanings.sent4: The operoseness of the puzzle left many scratching their heads in confusion.
meanings.sent5: The operoseness of the rules made the game almost impossible to play.
